articles.content:
Icelandic President on Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Iceland wishes to boost the relations with the DPRK and cooperate with it in the international arena, said Olafur Ragnar Grimsson, president of the Republic of Iceland, when receiving credentials from Jon In Chan, DPRK ambassador e.p. to Iceland, on June 15.
 The president appreciated the recent efforts to ease the tension and improve relations in and around the Korean peninsula.

Gifts to Kim Jong Il from Russian Figures 
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received gifts from Russian poet Byacheslav Orlov and writer Yuri Bondarev on the occasion of the 40th anniversary of his start of work at the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 The gifts were handed to the DPRK ambassador e.p. to Russia on June 18.

Greetings to Croatian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, June 25 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DRPK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Ivo Sanader, prime minister of the Republic of Croatia, on the occasion of the national day of its country.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would favorably develop in the interests of the two peoples, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his work for the well-being of the Croatian people.    
 Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to his Croatian counterpart Miomir Zuzul.

articles.content:
Working Talks between Olympic Committees of North and South Held
    Beijing, June 24 (KCNA) -- Working talks between the Olympic Committees of the north and the south of Korea were held in Beijing from June 23 to 24 to discuss the issue of the joint entry of the north and the south into the opening and closing ceremonies of the 28th Olympics.
 The talks were attended by the members of the delegation of the Olympic Committee of the north side led by Secretary General Jo Sang Nam and the members of the delegation of the Olympic Committee of the south side led by Honorary Manager Pak Yang Chon.    
 At the talks both sides adopted an agreement on the joint entry of the north and the south into the opening and closing ceremonies of the 28th Olympic Games.
